Issues.Title: How to make bulma Fixed navbar push down the whole page content on a mobile menu
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma v0.7.5
Question and need help

Overview of the problem

I would like to know how to make Bulma's fixed navbar push down the whole page of content when you are using a mobile device? Similar to how bootstrap does this with static top and collapse.

I have a project where the client needs the hamburger menu to open and push all content when it is expanded. 

I attempted to use an empty div and jquery slide.toggle and this does work however when you collapse the menu on mobile for some reason on Android and Iphone the screen almost shakes when the menu collapses.

Any help or examples of how to do this without having to use an empty div would be much appreciated.

Thank You
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "How to make bulma Fixed navbar push down the whole page content on a mobile menu" (#2634)

Issues.Title: All internal docs links require 2 redirects to load the final page
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **the Docs**.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

<!-- This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** -->
This is about the Bulma **Docs**
<!-- I'm using Bulma **version** [x.x.x] -->
<!-- My **browser** is: -->
<!-- This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [x.x.x] -->
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**?

### Description

<!-- Description of the bug, enhancement, or question -->

Whenever I click a link in the docs sidebar, I get taken through 2 redirects before I get to the page I wanted to see.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/icon/ with browser devtools open
2. Click on Delete (https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/delete)
3. See that the browser loads:
  * `https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/delete`, which redirects to
  * `http://bulma.io/documentation/elements/delete/` (note HTTP), which redirects to
  * `https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/delete/` and loads the page

Alternatively:

```console
$ wget https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/icon 2>&1 | grep "Location:"
Location: http://bulma.io/documentation/elements/icon/ [following]
Location: https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/icon/ [following]
```

### Expected behavior

The documentation page should load without redirects

### Actual behavior

My browser follows 2 redirects before loading the desired docs page.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "All internal docs links require 2 redirects to load the final page" (#2633)

Issues.Title: Obfuscated NPM command when JavaScript is disabled
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **the Docs**.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

<!-- This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** -->
This is about the Bulma **Docs**
<!-- I'm using Bulma **version** [x.x.x] -->
My **browser** is: Firefox 69.0 on macOS 10.14
<!-- This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [x.x.x] -->
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**?

### Description

When JavaScript is disabled, an NPM command gets obfuscated.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Disable JavaScript in your browser
2. Open the [With webpack](https://bulma.io/documentation/customize/with-webpack/) page of the documentation
3. Scroll down to "Install the dev dependencies"

### Expected behavior

<!-- What you expected to happen -->

I expect to be able to read all commands, even if I have JavaScript disabled.

### Actual behavior

<!-- What actually happened -->

The command `npm install extract-text-webpack-plugin@next --save-dev` is replaced by `
npm install [email protected] --save-dev` by Cloudflare, and `[email protected]` is a link to https://bulma.io/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection.

### Possible fix

A possible fix is documented on [What is Email Address Obfuscation?](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170016-What-is-Email-Address-Obfuscation-):

> #### Prevent Cloudflare from obfuscating email
> 
> To prevent Cloudflare from obfuscating emails, you can:
> 
> -  Add the following comment in the page HTML code:
>    `<!--email_off-->you email addresses, goes here<!--/email_off-->`
> 
> - Return email addresses in JSON format for AJAX calls, making sure your web server returns a content type of "application/json".

So, presumably, we could wrap the command in those comment tags and it should just work—though I'm not sure how to verify this myself.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Obfuscated NPM command when JavaScript is disabled" (#2628)

Issues.Title: Question about Image resizing properties.
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**.
This is a question and help request.

### Overview of the problem
Trying to align image to full column height, respecting higher one.

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** 
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.7.5]
My **browser** is: Firefox
 I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**? Nope.

### Description

Summary: Image responsive resize is forcing parent elements to adjust themselves and ignoring the height of the other column.

I am trying to make a description page, but I am not understanding how image resizing works, I already tried changing the parent element but it just ignores whatever I did, so I am seeking help. I don't mind giant image when in mobile mode as I will hide it anyway. My problem is with desktop view.

https://codepen.io/rodizipa/pen/pozLqyO

So if possible I want to keep the left column and image at right side with the same size as the right column in desktop view.


### Steps to Reproduce
Resize view, image will force container to expand or shrink. If you force the box to 100% height, image won't follow.

### Expected behavior

Image fills entire column height without making it higher or smaller than other column

### Actual behavior

shrinking or resizing image either:
If u didn't set fixed size parent: Image will shrink/expand column and ignore other one's height.
If u did fixed the size of parent: Parent will adjust but image will stay.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Question about Image resizing properties." (#2624)

Issues.Title: There is no `is-hidden-fullhd-only` helper
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma and the Docs**.

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**


### Description

There is no `is-hidden-fullhd-only` [helper](https://bulma.io/documentation/modifiers/responsive-helpers/#hide) (but there is a `is-hidden-fullhd`).

If this is intentional then I think the docs should explain why the asymmetry, if it is not, then it's a bug?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "There is no `is-hidden-fullhd-only` helper" (#2623)

Issues.Title: Docs: Add JavaScript filename example
Issues.Body:
Embedding it directly into the docs is better than an external jsfiddle,
especially since the code snippet is so simple.

This is a **documentation fix**.

### Proposed solution

See https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/issues/280#issuecomment-529114648.

It fixes the markup injection vulnerability and it moves the code under the control of Bulma.

### Tradeoffs

- This might be the first JS snippet integrated into the docs. I think it's still much better than an external page that isn't controlled by the Bulma project.
- I used an id attribute to reference the element, since the JS code does not run sandboxed for this example. We need to ensure that this id is unique.

### Testing Done

Tested it locally in my browser. Seems to work as intended.

![screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/105168/64488672-d4bbc880-d24a-11e9-8adc-d5a64da5498d.png)

### Changelog updated?

No, minor change.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Docs: Add JavaScript filename example" (#2621)

Issues.Title: Modal weird overlay shadow
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**. This is a bug with Modal component.

### Overview of the problem
This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.7.5
My **browser** is: Version 76.0.3809.132 (Official Build) (64-bit)
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**

### Description
There is an unknown box shadow area behind the modal-content.
![Screenshot from 2019-09-03 15-08-10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1917947/64155630-567fb080-ce5d-11e9-8a53-4c08cbeda056.jpg)

Click and open the image in full-size. It's kinda hard to see but it's there. I tagged the corners with 4 "x".

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Go to the official docs of Modal. https://bulma.io/documentation/components/modal/
2. Launch the first example modal.
3. Carefully watch for the unknown box shadow area behind the content. You could delete the close button to notice the different.

### Expected behavior

It should not be there.

### Actual behavior

There is a weird box shadow there.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Modal weird overlay shadow" (#2613)

Issues.Title: z-index on select arrow causing UI problems
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**.

It is a question

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.7.4
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**, but is possibly related to this: https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/issues/2248

### Description

The down arrow in the select element has a `z-index: 4` style rule applied to it which seems unnecessary, and maybe can be removed. Once you introduce z-index on an element it causes UI problems and maintenance headaches.

For example, we have a fixed footer on the page, and when the page is scrolled, the arrow (and only the arrow) appears above it when it's supposed to scroll behind.

Removing that z-index doesn't seem to affect the UI of the select element itself. I tested it on Mac desktop versions of Safari, Chrome, and Firefox.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "z-index on select arrow causing UI problems" (#2611)

Issues.Title: updated broken Fulma link
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "updated broken Fulma link" (#2608)

Issues.Title: [Question] Show certain navbar menu items on smaller devices
Issues.Body:
This is about the Bulma **CSS framework and docs**

### Description

In the "[basic navbar example](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/navbar/)," there are two sets of menu items -- the "main menu" in navbar-start, and two additional buttons in navbar-end.  

At desktop sizes, all of the menu items are visible:

![navbar-desktop](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23462125/63967699-d0293000-ca52-11e9-8561-2d02d2c73f92.jpg)

At mobile and tablet sizes, these menu items disappear into the hamburger menu:

![navbar-mobile](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23462125/63967716-d61f1100-ca52-11e9-91c0-7802d3f1134e.jpg)


### Question

Is there a way to make the buttons remain visible on tablet and mobile devices?  

I would like to hide the "main menu" on smaller devices, as is the default, while having the navbar-end items remain visible.  I.e., on mobile devices, the layout should be:

[LOGO]  ----------------- [SIGN UP]  [LOG IN]  [HAMBURGER]

In particular, is this possible to do using pure CSS, rather than SASS?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Question] Show certain navbar menu items on smaller devices" (#2609)

Issues.Title: [Question] Navbar - How to make multiple `navbar-menu` appear vertically
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma | the Docs**. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** This is about the Bulma **Docs** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.7.5] My **browser** is: Chrome ### Description I would like to create a navbar that has multiple horizontal menus. Not sure if that's currently possible or not. I couldn't find a relevant example in the docs or didn't see any restrictions being mentioned. When I add 2 `navbar-menu` element, they both appear in one line in the desktop view. I want them to appear vertically while the items within them are horizontal. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Start with the navbar example in the dos 2. Update the navbar code example so that it includes 2 `navbar-menu` as shown below: ```html
Link1 Link2 Link3 Link4
Home1 Documentation1
More1
About1 Jobs1 Contact1
Report an issue1
``` 3. View the navbar menu in the browser ### Expected behavior The `navbar-menu-sites` and `navbarBasicExample` each contains horizontal menu. But these two also appear horizontally. I expected to find info on how to make these two separate horizontal menu to appear vertically. ### Actual behavior Cannot find an option to make the 2 horizontal menus within the navbar to appear vertically. I added the following style, but that didn't seem to have any effect: ```css #navbarBasicExample { clear: both; } ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Question] Navbar - How to make multiple `navbar-menu` appear vertically" (#2607)
